CoinDesk also stated that "Todd denied both charges," when there were no charges to begin with, as this was a civil lawsuit. While they subsequently fixed these errors, Todd says the article "also misquotes me, which Coindesk has refused to fix."

Less than one day after the settlement was publicy announced, Lovecruft tweeted:

don’t mind me nothing to see here just using my first amendment right to let y’all know that PETER TODD IS A RAPIST and even though he didn’t rape me he told me he would and grabbed me and the only reason he didn’t succeed is that i kicked his idiot can’t-do-high-school-maths ass

hi! are you a cis man? ally here. have you been CREDIBLY ACCUSED OF RAPE? i’m here to let you know you have OPTIONS to FIX YOUR REPUTATION:

  1. apologise to your survivors, get therapy, strive to be a better person
  2. KILL YOURSELF

that’s it. those are the options.

When someone pointed out that reputations could not be fixed through suicide, they replied, "this is a feature, not a bug."

On or around July 13th, Lovecruft re-iterated the call for "rapists" to "apologise to their survivors" or "kill themselves, thus finally making their parent(s) proud." In response, Kobeïssi published a blog post to "summarize and respond to accusations that have been made against me." He pointed to a blog post published by Lovecruft on June 28th 2012, after the Rio de Janeiro RightsCon event that they both attended, when the alleged assault supposedly occurred. In contrast, Lovecruft's "nice" story recounts how they and other Tor Project people affectionately pressured "my friend Nadim" to implement mpOTR (see 'Len Sassaman and Plagiarism Allegations'), including with an email script. Lovecruft joked about this as "the minor hell I've been putting @kaepora through."

So, myself and some other people involved with Tor, and stuff and crypto and stuff, took to sending messages to Nadim in all sorts of fanciful and prankish ways, just to say “IMPLEMENT MPOTR.” Notes under the hotel room door in Brazil; late night phone calls; sharpie on his face after diving over a conference room table to tackle him. That sort of thing.

He states that since February 2019, he has "suffered profound and perhaps permanent psychological trauma," been "physically assaulted," and "banned from conferences and workshops without any recourse" as a result of the "false accusations."

I made sure in my testimony to indicate that I could not comment on the accusations Isis had made against others, as I had no certain way of knowing whether they were true or false. In fact, in 2016, I originally believed Isis’s claims against some other individual in my domain and even supported them. However, given Isis’s own claims about me, I find it difficult to personally continue to believe their claims about others.

Lovecruft re-shared their prior allegations, further claimed that Kobeïssi was "mass mobilising to get me blocked at the moment," and that they were being "sucked down into the swamp of dealing with wellknown abusers in infosec." They then stated: "idk these three i am not so sure they’re ever going to find any redemption at this point, i suspect there’s only destruction."

On or around August 5th, Lovecruft quoted Reilly when referring to Appelbaum, Kobeïssi, and Bernstein as "some of the primary sociopaths and enablers in cryptography." Once again, they falsely claimed Kobeïssi had "admitted under penalty of perjury in federal supreme court that he" non-consenually "stuck his tongue down my throat." When Kobeïssi countered that this was "a complete lie," he was blocked. (At some later point, Lovecruft deleted this tweet.)

On August 24th, Todd shared that he had been "uninvited from the Monero Konference" in February 2019 after "some donors from the Monero community and some members of the board have expressed concerns about certain recent allegations made against" him. In February 2022, after he had been announced as a speaker for an upcoming Bitcoin Conference in Miami, Nicole Dobrow subtweeted that they had given "a speaking spot to a known rapist," citing a thread on the lawsuit, and that this constituted "hostility to women and gender minorities." Dobrow claimed that Todd had "paid an undisclosed amount of money to settle," which had not been listed as a condition for either side in their settlement agreement. Todd replied: "That is false. I did not pay anything to anyone. Anyway, the conference you're alluding to is welcome to do their own investigation."

In February 2021, when Lovecruft vaguely accused de Valence of "violations of the Rust Community Code of Conduct" and "repeatedly displaying unacceptable behaviours towards several people" (see 'Isis Lovecruft'), Todd tweeted that "he is one of the people who knows first hand that Lovecruft fabricated assault allegations against me."

During April and May, Todd and Garrett continued to debate about the plausibility of Lovecruft's claims. Initially, Todd shared more Twitter direct message screenshots pertaining to conversations with Lovecruft in November 2014 and October 2015. Todd then shared the whole Twitter direct message history between October 2014 and April 2016, IRC logs between December 2014 and October 2015, and Pond messages between October 2015 and May 2016, as part of "making public more of the evidence with Isis."

In June, Todd shared this investigation in relation to the hiring of Chasteen by the Tor Project (see 'Leaked Tor-Internal Chat Logs'). Several days later, Reilly replied to both dismiss concern about those circumstances and argue that Appelbaum was responsible for making the community vulnerable to those threats:

Super secret spy conspiracies don’t begin with someone saying “Just so you know, I was really working for the CIA” then going away when asked. In other words, respecting consent. Which means several rapists in infosec could learn from spooks.

... Someone who sexually harasses colleagues who are trying to do the work, drives away open source code contributions, and sabotages non-government funding is a saboteur. If Jake had a CIA agent assigned to him, the spook would be sitting back, feet up, drinking martinis all day.
